programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: During the global pandemic, Jackson is more determined than ever to help cats in need. He virtually meets a couples ferocious felines and a familys unruly cat

programme.title: Pet Nation Renovation
programme.desc: Two-part special in which Dave Salmoni follows the renovation of deserving animal shelters, beginning with Bandits Adoption and Rescue of K9s in Ashland, Virginia

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Mike Boone relocates an alligator snapping turtle, Inman and Eddins get a poacher to confess, while Provaznik educates fishermen on the Texas coast

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff operates on a rottweiler with a broken shoulder and Dr Baier sees to a limping pig. The team heads to the mountains to treat some wolves

programme.desc: Pete Nelson installs a stainless steel kitchen in the trees for a family of sweet-makers. The treehouse also boasts barrel ceilings and a loft bedroom

programme.title: Guardians of Rescue
programme.desc: Rob and Elle investigate a claim about dogs on a hot roof. Brian and Face help a woman whose neighbour is provoking her dog

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Otto, Charlotte, Eivin and Eve butcher a cow to stock up on meat for winter, while Atz Srs range-riding skills are put to the test

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Browns struggle to finish their homes as the ground begins to freeze. Meanwhile, Rhain-Alisha goes into labour and the group race to be there for the birth

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Sage Halford seizes pit bulls that were allegedly used for fighting, and goes on to tackle their owner in court

programme.title: Pop Go the Sixties
programme.desc: A Whiter Shade of Pale by Procol Harum was one of the 1960s most popular and most-played songs. Its performed here by the group who first recorded it, on Top of the Pops in 1967

programme.title: White Christmas
programme.desc: A pair of former soldiers start a new career as nightclub entertainers. They try to boost the popularity of their old commanding officers struggling winter resort in Vermont by staging a series of extravagant shows, with a little help from their former army buddies and a talented singing sister act. Musical, starring Bing Crosby, Danny Kaye, Vera-Ellen, Dean Jagger, Sig Rumann, Mary Wickes, Anne Whitfield and Rosemary Clooney, featuring seasonal songs by Irving Berlin.

programme.title: Beaches
programme.desc: Brash child performer CC and rich girl Hillary become unlikely friends when they first meet at 11 years old. Years later they are still close, but Hillary, who is now a successful lawyer, is stricken with a terminal illness. CC goes to visit her and together they reflect on the highs and lows of their long, volatile relationship. Drama, starring Bette Midler, Barbara Hershey, John Heard and Mayim Bialik

programme.title: Imagine
programme.sub-title: Bette Midler: The Divine Miss M
programme.desc: Alan Yentob meets Bette Midler in New York, almost five decades after she began her rise from nightclub act to Hollywood star. At the age of 20, the woman who would become known as the Divine Miss M went from working in a pineapple-canning factory in Honolulu, Hawaii, to a role in the 1967 Broadway hit Fiddler on the Roof, and has never looked back. She recalls those early days, as well as the nightclubs and bathhouses of the 1970s, and how she finally made it to the top of the film industry, the combination of a raucous wit and soulful voice making her an outrageous but captivating all-round entertainer

programme.title: The Many Primes of Muriel Spark
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark presents a celebration of the author of The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie, in a programme originally shown in 2018 to mark the centenary of her birth. She revisits Sparks Edinburgh roots, talks to biographer Alan Taylor and conducts the first televised interview with Penelope Jardine, who was a close friend of the writer for 40 years. With contributions from AL Kennedy, Janice Galloway, Ali Smith, William Boyd and Val McDermid

programme.title: Close to Vermeer
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the largest Vermeer exhibition ever mounted, now on view at the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam. The documentary follows curators, conservators, collectors and experts in their joint mission to shine a new light on the elusive Dutch Master

programme.title: Concorde: A Supersonic Story
programme.desc: As new £19million museum Aerospace Bristol prepares to open, this documentary takes a look at the life of the most glamorous plane ever built. Rare footage tells the forgotten row between the French and British governments over the name of Concorde, which threatened to derail the whole project. Engineers, flight technicians and frequent fliers tell the supersonic story, aided by politician Michael Heseltine and actress Joan Collins, while a former passenger recalls sharing an intimate moment with the Rolling Stones. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 30 November 1998. Featuring Culture Club, The Beautiful South, Lynden David Hall, The Cardigans, U2, Kele Le Roc, Alanis Morissette and Cher

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Kate Thornton presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 6 November 1998. Featuring Alanis Morissette, Billie Piper, Aerosmith, Touch and Go, Pras, Another Level, M People and Cher

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: David Kid Jensen looks at the weekly pop chart from November 24 1977 and introduces the Carvells, Bonnie Tyler, Hot Chocolate, Darts, Leo Sayer, Santa Esmerelda, Abba, Wings, the Bee Gees and a Legs and Co dance sequence to Jonathan Richman

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: John Peel and Tommy Vance present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 22 November 1984. Featuring Nick Heyward, The Human League, Billy Ocean, Murray Head, Shakin Stevens and Chaka Khan.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Bjork and Jack Dee introduce the biggest-selling songs of 1995, plus the Christmas Day Number One - Michael Jacksons Earth Song. Featuring performances by N-Trance, Annie Lennox, Take That, Boyzone, the Outhere Brothers, Simply Red, Robson and Jerome, Pulp and Blur

programme.title: Country Music Association Awards 2025
programme.desc: Highlights of the 59th Country Music Association Awards show, from Bridgestone Arena in Nashville, US. American singer-songwriter Lainey Wilson is the 2025 host

programme.title: BBC Four Sessions
programme.desc: The American blues singer performs in concert at Stoke Newington Town Hall in north London, featuring tracks from across her career, spanning from the self-titled 1971 debut album to her April 2012 release, Slipstream. The set includes her signature tunes, Love Has No Pride, Nick of Time, and Love Me Like a Man. She is joined on stage by regular collaborator Paul Brady

programme.title: The Old Grey Whistle Test
programme.desc: A memorable edition of the iconic 1970s music series, introduced by Whispering Bob Harris and featuring a concert performance by American blues singer, guitarist, songwriter and activist Bonnie Raitt. First shown in March 1976

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Bjork and Jack Dee introduce the biggest-selling songs of 1995, plus the Christmas Day Number One - Michael Jacksons Earth Song. Featuring performances by N-Trance, Annie Lennox, Take That, Boyzone, the Outhere Brothers, Simply Red, Robson and Jerome, Pulp and Blur

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 30 November 1998. Featuring Culture Club, The Beautiful South, Lynden David Hall, The Cardigans, U2, Kele Le Roc, Alanis Morissette and Cher

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: John Peel and Tommy Vance present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 22 November 1984. Featuring Nick Heyward, The Human League, Billy Ocean, Murray Head, Shakin Stevens and Chaka Khan.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Matt Allwright and Gaby Roslin host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.sub-title: I Was Part of the Worlds Largest Scam
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Louise Minchin and Julia Somerville unite the victim of an international investment scam network with one of the investigative journalists who uncovered it. At least 32,000 people lost more than £200 million in the crime. Plus, how purchasing gift cards on someone elses behalf can leave someone vulnerable to being scammed, and the Liverpool fan who was left empty-handed when he tried to buy tickets from an unofficial seller

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin and Jacqui Joseph track the progress on renovations on a Suffolk bungalow, a former chapel in Staffordshire and a 1930s semi-detached house in Bexleyheath, south-east London

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley hosts from Shrewsbury in Shropshire, where experts Thomas Forrester and Mark Stacey guide the red and blue teams as they go in search of some bargains before selling them at auction in Lichfield. Caroline also visits RAF Cosford to learn about a team of Spitfire-flying women

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: The team closes in on scammers posing as the UKs National Crime Agency. Confronting them with their crimes spooks the fraudsters, but it is going to take more than one hit to put this bunch of cybercriminals out of action. Presented by Rav Wilding and Nick Stapleton

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Ex-musician Matt is hoping to turn his furniture-making hobby into a business, but has a confidence problem that mentor Bruce Kenneth needs to find a way to get him past. Mentor Piyush Suri wants to help textile designer Jess make money from her hobby but first she needs to broaden her product range

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah visits Scotland, making her way to Dumfries and Galloway with a married couple from London who are seeking a life-changing move. Theyre hoping their £350,000 budget can buy a house for them with enough land for a retreat business. Sonali also visits an ethical dairy farm that has written a brand new rule book when it comes to animal welfare

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.sub-title: Egg Chair, Roller Skates, Boxing Belt
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presides as five sellers aim to get the best price for their items including the Peter Ghyczy Egg Chair, a pair of roller-skates, an Art Deco dining room suite, a mid-century braille micrometer and a replica boxing belt

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Tim Medhursts road trip rolls into Edinburgh, packed with laughs, surprises and oddball finds. Tim falls for a whimsical pair of faux-bois fairy chairs, while Tash is drawn to a mythical beast in the form of brass fire dogs. However, its a deceptively delicate piece of porcelain that might just steal the show. Away from the shops, the duo discover a local company dedicated to keeping the traditional art of tapestry alive

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Anita Rani

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Alex Jones host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Anthony looks to the future, Kims slip-up has consequences for Elaine, and the truth dawns on a horrified local

programme.title: Celebrity Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams travel through the breathtaking beauty of Costa Rica, a country that contains five per cent of the worlds biodiversity, before reaching Panama, the seventh country of the race. The next checkpoint is Bocas del Toro, an archipelago off Panamas Caribbean coast

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: For the second quarter-final, the celebrities take on the pairs challenge. Each duo has their own recipe and must deliver two identical portions of that dish, but will be working on separate benches, and only one of them will have access to the recipe. The recipes in this round are both desserts, a bakewell tart and a millefeuille. Judges Grace Dent and John Torode have one more challenge up their culinary sleeves. The contenders need to prepare their most splendid two-course menu for three special diners - Celebrity MasterChef 2024 champion Vito Coppola and former finalists Rochenda Sandall and Harry Aikines-Aryeetey

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers reviews the weeks political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Watford, Hertfordshire, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A panel of BBC journalists hosts a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Tell Me Lies
programme.sub-title: Dont Struggle Like That, or I Will Only Love You More
programme.desc: Its the end of term and Christmas celebrations change everything for everyone - yet again

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Matt Allwright and Kimberley Walsh host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.sub-title: Fake Michael Jackson Brought Bailiffs to My Door
programme.desc: A man whose home address was hijacked by a fraudster using the name Michael Jackson who received traffic fines and a visit from a bailiff and now says the authorities wont help. Plus, how a leading airlines loyalty points scheme is being targeted by thieves. To round off BBC Scam Safe week, Julia Somerville, Louise Minchin and Gloria Hunniford revisit some of its biggest scam stories to look at how criminals tactics have evolved over the years

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin feels like he has a mountain to climb in Blackpool at a mid-terrace with potential subsidence. Hes also in Leicester, grappling with a non-standard construction property. Martin Roberts is in Somerset where he meets a mother-and-daughter team on a mission to create a dream home from a somewhat smelly cottage

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams of sisters search for money-making items at an antiques fair in Llandeilo, Carmarthenshire, with the help of mentors Izzie Balmer and Richard Madley. Presenter Roo Irvine monitors proceedings and also quizzes fairgoers about the identity of a mystery rotating wooden object with holes and a handle

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When a classic car is stolen from a local showroom, it looks like a disgruntled employee has taken his revenge after being sacked. The cops soon discover that bodybuilder Aaron has been displaying aggressive behaviour and suspicions are raised that he has been taking steroids, possibly supplied by Donals secret girlfriend Sasha. Brandi thinks Clint should tell Nicole hes lost £25,000, but Clint is hoping hell get the cash back before she finds out

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton meets a couple who have spent the last six years travelling the globe and have their entire belongings in two rucksacks. With £325,000 to hand, the pair have decided they need a base in the Wiltshire countryside, and Alistair is the man to show them what this gorgeous county has to offer. He also meets an intensive care nurse at her much-loved and fruitful allotment

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: A masked Mexican wrestler delivers a championship belt from his sport for the buyers to consider. A penny-farthing bicycle is also presented, thought it is probably more of a prop than a viable method of transport. Other items include a vintage harmonium, miniature garden and an art deco lamp. Presented by Nigel Havers

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.sub-title: A Rock n Roll Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Tim Medhursts road trip rolls into Glasgow, Tashs hame toon. Tim banks on a thoroughly Scottish piece of pottery and hopes a seafaring find will float the bidders boat. Tashs eclectic haul features a tribute to a famous naval hero, a spooky skull and a very cheeky bathing beauty thats sure to raise eyebrows in the saleroom

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Anita Rani

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Farm 999
programme.sub-title: Illegal Blood Sports and Tractor Sabotage
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, farmer Helen Smith has endured years of intimidation from illegal off-road bikers tearing across her land. Now, with her elderly mother living in fear after shots were fired at their home, police are determined to track down the gang behind the violence. In Hampshire, officers pursue men suspected of terrorising wildlife and wrecking farmland by taking part in the illegal blood sport of hare coursing. Plus, reporter Paul Colgan discovers how farmers in the Scottish Highlands doubling as on-call firefighters are using cutting-edge technology to protect their rural communities

programme.title: Return to Paradise
programme.desc: When some of Colins friends visit from England to relive their legendary Dolphin Cove backpacking holiday, one of them wakes up to find a strangers corpse in his locked motel room, with no sign of how the killer got out. While Colin is revisiting history with an old crush, Mack and Glenn take increasingly desperate steps to extinguish their growing fire. Drama, starring Anna Samson and Lloyd Griffith

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guests hosts, with writer and broadcaster Richard Osman and comedian Bella Hull joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news. As usual, all concerned poke fun at the weeks headlines

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Longing for her old life, Gemma tries reliving a past night out, only to realise she has changed for ever and misses Sadie. Malcolm assumes babysitting duties, only to find his evening upturned by Derek, who ropes the grandfather into helping him exact revenge on his ex-wife. In an attempt to support his friend, while keeping Sadie safe from all perceived threats, Malcolm panics when Gemma announces she is coming home early. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The Blame Game
programme.desc: Tim McGarry, Colin Murphy, Diona Doherty and Neil Delamere are joined by guest Milton Jones for the panel show taking a sideways look at the weeks news. Comedy asides and good craic abound as they turn their wit and satirical spin on the people and events who are making the news in Northern Ireland and beyond

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by eight-time Oscar-nominee Glenn Close, who is joining the cast of Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery. Also on the sofa are Emmy-winning Swedish star Alexander Skarsgard, who is playing a biker in British love story Pillion, actress and national treasure Miriam Margolyes, discussing her anthology The Little Book of Miriam, and Bridgerton star Nicola Coughlan, who is taking to the National Theatre stage. Plus, Jessie J performs HAPPY from her album Dont Tease Me with a Good Time

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: Choreographer Claudimar Neto coaches the queens as they write and perform a show-stopping original song. As ever, its a family line-up for the finale, with Michelle Visage, Alan Carr and Graham Norton forming the judging panel, and last years winner and reigning champion, Kyran Thrax, dropping in along with the seasons eliminated queens

programme.title: Alan Carrs Picture Slam
programme.desc: Alan Carr hosts the game show in which three teams of contestants have to identify a board full of images, with a chance of winning up to £10,000 if they know them all. The contestants are siblings Jack and Hannah from Aberdare and Cardiff, mother and daughter Jacqui and Lola from Stockport, and friends Mel and Liz from Sydenham and High Wycombe

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Gruesome events and characters from the past. This episode ventures on holiday with Queen Vic, enjoys a view of Napoleon the tourist attraction and has some deadly treats to eat

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present as Strictly Come Dancing stars Gemma Atkinson, Gorka Marquez, Aljaz Skorjanec, Janette Manrara, Clara Amfo and Johannes Radebe take part in the music-based quiz show, with a £10,000 charity jackpot up for grabs. Across three rounds, their knowledge is put to the test, as they attempt to identify huge hits from across the years. Whether its a song from the swinging 60s or the number-one track in todays charts, the teams must prove their ability to recognise songs from all genres of music - from pop to country, rock to RandB and many more

programme.title: Alan Carrs Picture Slam
programme.desc: Alan Carr hosts the game show in which three teams of contestants have to identify a board full of images, with a chance of winning up to £10,000 if they know them all. Playing this week are a mother and daughter from Kings Lynn, and two couples from Great Yarmouth and Glasgow

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: Choreographer Claudimar Neto coaches the queens as they write and perform a show-stopping original song. As ever, its a family line-up for the finale, with Michelle Visage, Alan Carr and Graham Norton forming the judging panel, and last years winner and reigning champion, Kyran Thrax, dropping in along with the seasons eliminated queens

programme.title: Survivor Australia
programme.desc: Twelve pairs of loved ones take on the challenge of the Aussie format of the hit game show in the wilderness of Charters Towers in Queensland. Returning contestant Andy takes charge of the Water Tribe, but is it really a good idea to be front and centre?

programme.title: Survivor Australia
programme.desc: More action from the Down Under take on Survivor. Trust and Unity are important in the game of Survivor. Will Shay vote with her trusted alliance member Briana or jump ship to support the unity of the tribe and vote out Chrissy?

programme.title: Scam Land: Money, Mayhem and Maseratis
programme.desc: Journalist Mobeen Azhar investigates the story of Gurvin Singh, a medical student who one evening near Christmas, decided to hand out free cash to unsuspecting strangers in Plymouth city centre. He told the local paper that he was giving back to the community having made thousands of pounds through forex trading. Weeks later rumours were rife that Gurvins trading claims were a scam. With meme pages and social media profiles providing the clues, Mobeen discovers that Gurvin is at the centre of an alleged scam involving millions of pounds

programme.title: Scam Land: Money, Mayhem and Maseratis
programme.desc: Mobeen Azhar investigates the world of online forex trading, discovering a world where remarkably similar claims of success suggest that the story of Gurvin could be one of many. Having tried to make contact with Mr Gurvz, as hes known online, Mobeen is blocked from his social media accounts. A tip-off leads him to a south London community group who were also involved in a forex investment that didnt go to plan. The conversation provides a revelation that potentially links both cases to an established brand with offices right in the heart of Londons financial district

programme.title: Confessions of a Teenage Fraudster
programme.desc: Between the ages of 17 and 21, Elliot Castro managed to commit fraudulent activity amounting to a estimated £2 million. This documentary continues his story. With a trail of crime stretching across several continents as he continued to live life on the run, then 18-year-old Elliot became more paranoid than ever and a stint in foreign jail seemed just around the corner

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: Choreographer Claudimar Neto coaches the queens as they write and perform a show-stopping original song. As ever, its a family line-up for the finale, with Michelle Visage, Alan Carr and Graham Norton forming the judging panel, and last years winner and reigning champion, Kyran Thrax, dropping in along with the seasons eliminated queens

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Artists Leonardo da Vinci and Michelangelo are the guides for a journey through the Renaissance, one of historys most creative, and sometimes weirdest, periods

programme.title: Dolittle
programme.desc: In Victorian era Britain, Dr John Dolittle is a Welsh vet with the ability to communicate with animals. After his wife, Lily, dies at sea, he retreats from society and only tends to animals. However, he is eventually drawn into a mission to save the Queens life. Fantasy adventure, starring Robert Downey Jr, Antonio Banderas and Michael Sheen, while Emma Thompson, Rami Malek and Tom Holland lend their voices to some of the creatures

programme.title: Here We Go
programme.desc: Rachel attempts to help Amy get a job with an old friend from school, and Paul ropes Sam into filming content for his new YouTube fitness channel. Alison Steadman, Katherine Parkinson, Jim Howick, Tom Basden, Freya Parks and Tori Allen-Martin star

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Longing for her old life, Gemma tries reliving a past night out, only to realise she has changed for ever and misses Sadie. Malcolm assumes babysitting duties, only to find his evening upturned by Derek, who ropes the grandfather into helping him exact revenge on his ex-wife. In an attempt to support his friend, while keeping Sadie safe from all perceived threats, Malcolm panics when Gemma announces she is coming home early. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: Celebrity Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams travel through the breathtaking beauty of Costa Rica, a country that contains five per cent of the worlds biodiversity, before reaching Panama, the seventh country of the race. The next checkpoint is Bocas del Toro, an archipelago off Panamas Caribbean coast

programme.title: Survivor Australia
programme.desc: The Aussie version of the hit game show continues. When David takes on Brianas dream to be sole Survivor, hes not worrying about the consequences - until he throws his strongest relationship into the line of fire. Will Sam stay loyal to the back-stabbing David or play her own game, eliminating him just like her Blood did on the other tribe?

programme.title: Survivor Australia
programme.desc: Building relationships is an important strategy to get to the end. However, when Sam must choose between getting out a threat and friend or the recently turned enemy, she must do whats best for her end-game. Whether it is the right decision remains to be seen

programme.title: Scam Land: Money, Mayhem and Maseratis
programme.desc: Mobeen Azhar tries to understand what drives people to trade and uncovers a link between an established financial brand with offices in the City of London and the case of Gurvin

programme.title: Scam Land: Money, Mayhem and Maseratis
programme.desc: Mobeen Azhar gets closer to Gurvin and a meeting with a whistleblower raises questions about marketing and responsibility in the multi-billion-pound world of retail forex trading

programme.title: Fake Friend: The Ticket Scammer
programme.desc: The case of a Somerset high-flyer who turned his charm and connections into tools of deception, conning his friends and hundreds of others, while living a life of glamour himself. Through the voices of his victims and event industry insiders, this documentary uncovers the high personal and financial cost of chasing exclusivity, and how easily even the most cautious can be deceived

His late mothers dream was for Gordon to turn the 120-year-old cattle shed and milking parlour into a home for himself, so he and partner Lisa have set out to make that a reality, creating their first home together. Will it end up being something his mother would have been proud of?

programme.desc: Neurosurgeon and scientist Richard Mair races to treat patients with deadly brain cancers as part of a world-first clinical trial intended to give patients more time. He analyses patients tumour DNA and rapidly matches them with targeted drugs. It could be the biggest leap forward in brain cancer for 30 years. Taking part in the trial is family man David, whos having brain surgery and tests to discover if he has an aggressive cancer. Amanda was one of the first people to join Richards trial, after discovering that her brain tumour had returned. She prepares to hear the results of some vital tests

programme.title: Lidl vs Fortnum and Mason: Who Does Christmas Better?
programme.desc: For those who like to shop at high-end department stores, this documentary investigates whether they should stick with premium products from Fortnum and Mason this Christmas or if they can get deluxe for less at German discounter Lidl. The programmes reveal this years Christmas products from both retailers, including Fortnum and Masons luxury hampers and gifts from Lidls middle aisle, while seasonal treats including smoked salmon, Christmas pudding and port also go head to head in a series of taste tests. Who will come out on top?

programme.title: The Big Snow of 82
programme.desc: News archive, home movies and interviews with celebrities are combined to look back at the extreme weather that hit Britain in December and January more than 40 years ago. programme.title: Britains Favourite 70s Sitcoms

Theres also a look at how Fawlty Towers became a huge hit, and how a real-life love affair inspired Carla Lane to write suburban sitcom Butterflies. programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howards fear of commitment causes him to avoid Bernadette, but he soon realises he has made a mistake and tries to compensate for it. Meanwhile, Kripke plays a prank during a radio interview with Sheldon, who sets out to get revenge, only to be caught by the Dean. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star, with an appearance by Katee Sackhoff (Battlestar Galactica) as herself

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Bernadette asks Leonard about his physics experiment, making Howard so jealous that she threatens to end their relationship. Penny also feels put out by the situation, and asks Sheldon to teach her about science. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Melissa Rauch star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonards mother visits and he is horrified to learn that Sheldon knows more than he does about his own family, including his parents impending divorce and the death of his dog. Guest starring Christine Baranski

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj lusts after a girl he and Sheldon meet at a university party, and Leonard comes to regret airing his disapproval of Pennys belief in psychics. Comedy, starring Kunal Nayyar and Jim Parsons

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: Gluons, Guacamole and the Colour Purple
programme.desc: When Sheldon is no longer academically challenged at Medford High School, he audits a college class taught by his pen pal Dr John Sturgis. Wallace Shawn and Michael Cudlitz guest star alongside Iain Armitage

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Dog, a Squirrel and a Fish Named Fish
programme.desc: A neighbourhood battle erupts between the Coopers and the Sparks family when the Sparks new dog terrorises Sheldon. US comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer turns coach when Bart excels at computer game competitions, but when Lisa tries to bring her dad back to reality her plan causes complete chaos

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: An all-female reboot of Krustys show leads Bart to join a group of protesters who commit crimes against the patriarchy

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Rajs sister Priya visits the gang, causing tension when Leonard tries to cover up the fling he once had with her. After discovering his friends secret, Sheldon struggles to keep quiet, leading the guys to reveal information they have all been keeping from one another

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard vows to be more self-assured around women, believing his problem attracting a girlfriend stems from a lack of confidence. An FBI agent interviews the gang to assess Howards suitability for a team working on a new surveillance satellite. Guest starring Eliza Dushku

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends set up camp outside a cinema to get tickets for a new cut of Raiders of the Lost Ark - but find themselves resuming hostilities with Sheldons old foe Wil Wheaton, the former Star Trek: The Next Generation actor. Meanwhile, Penny and Bernadette invite Amy to a sleepover

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Pennys father pays a visit and Leonard discovers she told her parents they were back together, so he plays his boyfriend role to the hilt - much to her dismay. Meanwhile, Raj gets drunk and makes a pass at Howards girlfriend Bernadette. Guest starring Keith Carradine

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart lands a job as assistant to his idol Krusty the Clown and even gets to say his own catchphrase in front of the cameras, winning instant celebrity status. Featuring the guest voice of TV host Conan OBrien

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer finds himself being rushed to hospital suffering from food poisoning as a consequence of Apus misconduct at the Kwik-E-Mart. Featuring the guest voice of James Woods

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge convinces the town to pass anti-bullying legislation after Bart gets picked on at the school dance. Homer then gets arrested and sent to rehab for targeting Ned Flanders, only to subsequently leave the facility as a hero

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: When a modernised Springfield Elementary School has a technical meltdown, Lisa does her best to transform it into a different institution. During the process, Groundskeeper Willie coaches her and the other members of the Mathlympics team for an important maths quiz against their Waverly Hill rivals

programme.title: Americas Next Top Model
programme.desc: The girls are challenged to attend four castings in as many hours, which proves tricky for those who are unfamiliar with Los Angeles. A photoshoot at a landfill site causes problems for Molly, while Brittani embraces the challenge. After the elimination, the remaining contestants are whisked to Morocco for the rest of the competition

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation
programme.desc: The team of secret agents faces being shut down when the head of the CIA convinces the US Senate that it is too dangerous. The operatives of the Impossible Mission Force become fugitives when they defy orders and plot to bring down a shadowy society of assassins. Spy thriller sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Rebecca Ferguson and Simon Pegg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Bernadette and Howard host a dinner party, but as it falls on Sheldons Thai food night, he opts to bring his own dinner. As punishment for his lack of manners, the gang decides he should organise Wolowitzs cluttered wardrobe, but he discovers an unopened letter from Howards father, who hasnt made contact in years

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys compete for a tenured professor position at the university, leading them to try to win over the committee in charge of appointing a new staff member, and arguing about who deserves the spot the most. However, the panel includes Mrs Davis from Human Resources, whom Sheldon has crossed paths with before. Guest starring Regina King

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. First up is 24-year-old Rebecca, a singer from Nottinghamshire who is tired of always having her heart broken by guys with a bad boy image and wants to see if choosing a date in the studio can help her pick a better mate. Next up is 25-year-old development manager Dan from Durham, who has unsuccessfully tried countless dating apps and hopes to find Mr Right

programme.title: Americas Next Top Model
programme.desc: A recap of the action and drama from series 16 on the modelling contest

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart joins an organisation called the Junior Campers and asks Homer to come on a father-son rafting expedition. Unfortunately, the pair soon find themselves adrift on the open sea - with only Ned Flanders and his children for company. With the voice of Ernest Borgnine

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Gloria tricks Phil and Joe into participating in the local malls new ad campaign, technology gets the better of Jay during a video conference, and Cam faces up to a school bully

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly reignites a long-standing feud after she invites Murrays unreliable brother to visit at Thanksgiving. Meanwhile, Adam upsets the balance of power between him and Barry after he wins a ball game between them for the first time. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: A territorial battle develops in the corridors of power. Sir Humphrey has skilfully moved the PMs political adviser Dorothy Wainwright out of her office - but she insists on moving back. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: The government faces financial ruin, but that does not seem to worry Sir Humphrey, who goes to extreme lengths to get his latest pay rise scheme approved. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim has his first encounter with the Foreign Office and discovers they are something of a law unto themselves. He learns they are keeping reports of a communist coup secret and refusing to vote as he wishes in a UN debate on the Middle East. Comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker runs the risk of upsetting the Church of England by recommending one of two rather dubious characters for a new bishop. Meanwhile, Humphrey has his own reasons for wanting a third. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: MI5 reveals its former head was a double agent who worked as a Russian spy. To make matters worse, he had been investigated and given security clearance by Sir Humphrey. Classic satire, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim tries to improve employment figures by moving military units around the country. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington, Nigel Hawthorne and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim tries to improve employment figures by moving military units around the country. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington, Nigel Hawthorne and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: The Last Hurrah
programme.desc: A headstrong New England mayor launches one final re-election campaign. However, he finds the nature of politics is changing and he has a powerful enemy in a wealthy and influential local banker. John Fords drama, starring Spencer Tracy, Basil Rathbone, Jeffrey Hunter and Pat OBrien

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: A long-serving marshal, who has done his utmost to the keep peace in the town of Medicine Bend, looks forward to a reconciliation with his estranged wife, a touring musical star. Just as she arrives in town, three notorious criminals show up and start causing trouble - and the lawman has to decide whether to hang up his guns for his wifes sake or do his duty. Western, with Randolph Scott, Angela Lansbury, Jean Parker and Warner Anderson

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton
programme.desc: Lord Loam is proud of his tendency to treat his staff as equals - to a point - while his manservant Crichton believes people should know their place. However, when the entire household is shipwrecked on a desert island, it is the resourceful butler who rises to the top of the pecking order - to the horror of his supposedly liberal master. Comedy based on JM Barries play, starring Kenneth More, Cecil Parker, Diane Cilento and Peter Graves

programme.title: Gift Horse
programme.desc: A Navy captain reluctantly takes command of an old US destroyer during the Second World War and struggles with a crew who do not respect his authority. However, the prospect of facing the mighty German force brings much-needed unity. Adventure, starring Trevor Howard, Richard Attenborough, Bernard Lee, Sonny Tufts and James Donald

programme.title: Enemy Mine
programme.desc: In the midst of a war between humans and aliens, two space pilots from opposite sides are marooned together on an inhospitable planet and are forced to set aside their mutual animosity to survive. Sci-fi adventure, starring Dennis Quaid, Louis Gossett Jr and Brion James

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds
programme.desc: American officer Aldo Raine leads a squad of soldiers into occupied France on a mission to kill as many Nazis as possible and spread fear through the Third Reich. They become involved in a Jewish resistance fighters plan to blow up the premiere of a propaganda movie - due to be attended by Hitler himself. Quentin Tarantinos wartime adventure, with Brad Pitt, Melanie Laurent, Diane Kruger, Michael Fassbender and an Oscar-winning Christoph Waltz

programme.title: Freaky
programme.desc: Seventeen-year-old Millie Kessler spends her days trying to survive high school and the cruel actions of the popular crowd. But when she becomes the latest target of the Butcher, the towns infamous serial killer, her senior year becomes the least of her worries. When the Butchers mystical dagger causes him and Millie to magically switch bodies, the frightened teen learns she has just 24 hours to get her identity back before she looks like a middle-aged maniac for ever. Comedy horror, starring Vince Vaughn and Kathryn Newton

programme.title: Deerskin
programme.desc: A man seeking a fresh start after his divorce relocates to an Alpine village, where he poses as an independent film-maker and becomes obsessed with a vintage deerskin jacket. He imagines the jacket is talking to him, and persuades a local bartender to help him document his new mission - helping it to become the only jacket in the world. Comedy horror, starring Jean Dujardin and Adele Haenel. In French with English subtitles

programme.title: Barnacle Bill
programme.desc: The latest in a long line of seafarers tries to save a derelict Victorian pier from demolition by getting it registered as a vessel. Ealing comedy, starring Alec Guinness, Irene Browne, Maurice Denham and Lionel Jeffries

programme.title: Yesterdays Enemy
programme.desc: A British officer leading a patrol through the Burmese jungle during the Second World War uses brutal methods to gain vital intelligence from prisoners, to the outrage of a chaplain and war correspondent travelling with them. When the unit is captured by Japanese forces, he faces similar treatment at the hands of his captors. Drama, starring Stanley Baker, Guy Rolfe and Leo McKern.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: A publicity-seeking actress with an urge to be famous comes up with a plan to make a name for herself. She rents a billboard in New York with her name and picture on it, and soon becomes an overnight sensation - despite not actually being famous for anything. Meanwhile, a wealthy playboy becomes infatuated with her, to the consternation of her film-maker boyfriend. Comedy, starring Judy Holliday, Peter Lawford and Jack Lemmon in his screen debut

programme.title: Mysterious Island
programme.desc: Soldiers escaping the American Civil War take flight in a giant observation balloon and land far away on a strange uncharted island, where they encounter giant creatures, cut-throat pirates, two shipwrecked Englishwomen - and the mysterious Captain Nemo. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Vernes novel, starring Michael Craig, Herbert Lom, Joan Greenwood and Michael Callan, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: A recently divorced bookshop owner finds love with a glamorous Hollywood film star, but ends up the focus of unwanted media interest - which makes maintaining a relationship a tricky proposition. Romantic comedy written by Richard Curtis, starring Hugh Grant, Julia Roberts, Rhys Ifans, Emma Chambers, James Dreyfus and Gina McKee

programme.title: Nobody
programme.desc: A quiet and unassuming family man slowly reveals his true character after his house is burgled by two petty thieves. The aftermath of the incident ignites his long-simmering rage, triggering dormant instincts and propelling him on a brutal path that brings to the surface dark secrets and lethal skills. Crime drama, starring Bob Odenkirk, Connie Nielsen and Aleksey Serebryakov

programme.title: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: Motorcycle stuntman Johnny Blaze sells his soul to diabolical Mephistopheles to save the life of his father. His bargain dooms him to pass each night as Ghost Rider, a demonic skeletal biker bound to take evil souls to Hell. However, conflict between Mephistopheles and his son offers Johnny the chance to win back his humanity. Fantasy thriller based on the comic-book, starring Nicolas Cage, Eva Mendes and Wes Bentley

programme.title: Monster Hunter
programme.desc: When Cpt Artemis and her loyal soldiers are transported to a new world, they engage in a desperate battle for survival against enormous enemies with incredible powers. Fantasy adventure based on the video game, starring Milla Jovovich, Tony Jaa and Ron Perlman

programme.title: The Texas Rangers
programme.desc: Train robber Sam Bass assembles a gang of outlaws into a gang that proves more than a match for the Texas Rangers, so the major frees two men from prison and employs them to help find the bandits. Western, starring George Montgomery, Gale Storm, William Bishop and Noah Beery Jr

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: A renegade Apache plans to murder Cochises peace representative at the Cannon ranch, starting an Indian war

programme.title: Seminole Uprising
programme.desc: Cavalry lieutenant Cam Elliott is ordered to bring in Seminole chief Black Cat, who is leading his people in a campaign of terror and bloodshed. The tribal leader then kidnaps the girl Elliot loves and plans to trade her for more weapons from renegades. Western, starring George Montgomery, Steven Ritch and Karin Booth

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: At the request of his friends wife, Randall comes to assist and protect a war buddy in his bid for the towns mayoralty, quickly running afoul of the established political machine and its corrupt mayor and wanted sheriff

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A bounty hunter is not a hero in his own hometown, as Josh learns when he honours a dying friends request to return his body to Cameron and the townspeople rush to judgment, believing Josh killed him for the reward money.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is approached by the wife of a wanted man eager to turn himself in peacefully, provided Josh splits the bounty with his wife. To ensure the deal goes as planned, Josh enlists the aid of his old friend Sheriff Pat Garrett

programme.title: The Persuaders!

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Steed finds himself having to trust agent Melville, who has lost three partners and seems to be lying constantly, as he attempts to convict Lord Edgefield of blackmail. Patrick Macnee stars

programme.title: The New Avengers

programme.title: Shooter

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Affair at the Victory Ball

programme.desc: A cancer patient dies unexpectedly after a visit from Dr Ormerod and the grieving family points the finger at him - leading to his arrest on suspicion of murder. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jenny and Dennis are forced to cut short their honeymoon in Spain, and Gina grows increasingly unhappy at the thought of having to give up her job as pub licensee to marry a policeman. Ventress creates a bad impression at the station, and a crooked travel agent finds a way of cashing in on local holiday-makers absence, while Vernon organises a Bentley owners rally at the hall. Sarah Tansey and Duncan Bell star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Dr Merrick is called out to a remote farmhouse, where she discovers three children have been left orphaned by the death of their father. Adamant that the family should stay together, Steve helps the eldest fight a custody battle, but a series of obstacles stands in their way. Meanwhile, Vernon opens a caravan park, but it is David who ends up having to entertain the not-so-happy campers

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Perdy looks for proof of Matthews claim that Gray framed him for murder and confronts her husband when she finds evidence of the plot - leading to a dramatic showdown between the pair. programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Hour-long episode. Hayley spends the night at Beckys while a devastated Roy struggles to keep his head above water in the cafe. Tyrones efforts to rumble Paul backfire and Liam shares a drink with Maria.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The house is made open to the public for a day to raise money for the hospital, an act that divides opinions among the family and the servants. Tensions between Violet and Cora come to a head as a decision is made about the hospital takeover, Mr Dawes has a proposition for Molesley, and Baxter is thrown into turmoil by an unexpected letter. Carson is not happy with Thomas, but all is not as it appears, while Mary and Edith hope to overcome their past and find new happiness with the men in their lives

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detectives curiosity is aroused by the passengers on board a luxury cruise ship bound for Egypt - particularly a woman who appears inordinately offensive to her fellow travellers. When the vessel arrives at Alexandria, the irritating ladys body is discovered in her cabin - leaving the sleuth with a host of possible suspects to interrogate. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Steve does his bit for the community by taking a group of delinquents on an outdoor adventure course on the moors, but one of the lads falls and breaks his ankle, while another is wanted for stealing from a shop. Vernon sees a money-making opportunity when a religious sect arrives in Aidensfield looking for somewhere to hold a meditation convention. Rural police drama, starring James Carlton and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An elderly man reports an unusual break-in, during which the uninvited visitor left a mysterious statue on the kitchen table. It soon emerges that it is just the first in a series of unexplained events, as a police phone box arrives and then disappears from his garden, cement is delivered to his house for no apparent reason and a fire is started in his garage. Noakes advises Steve to keep well away as it is not technically a police matter, but the officer decides to investigate further. Rural drama, starring Trevor Ray, Georgie Glen and James Carlton

programme.title: Rosemary and Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are enlisted to design a memorial garden based on the myth of Orpheus and Eurydice, but someone begins vandalising their work on a nightly basis. Matters are complicated still further by the death of a recovering alcoholic, whose body is found at the site. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris, with Phyllida Law, Joanna David and Daisy Dunlop

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Primary school teacher Lizzy Swann is found dead at the bottom of a cliffside coastal walkway, but what appears at first to be a terrible accident, quickly becomes a murder investigation as Vera discovers evidence the body has been tampered with. Interviews with those who knew Lizzy paint a troubling picture of a guarded and paranoid woman who seemed to be burning bridges with friends and family alike in the days leading up to her death

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Religious fanatic Steven Mullan is found beaten and drowned in his bath. Lewis and Hathaway discover he had been imprisoned for trying to kill well-known atheist Tom Rattan and had only recently been released. The inspector soon has reason to believe the Rattan family is hiding something from him - but nothing prepares him for the evidence Dr Hobson uncovers at the post-mortem. Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox star, with guest appearances by Jenny Seagrove and Julian Wadham

Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee and Tamzin Malleson star in the murder mystery, with Joe Absolom, Andrew-Lee Potts, Justin Salinger, Amanda Burton and Stephanie Leonidas

Thriller, starring Henry Cavill, Bruce Willis and Sigourney Weaver

Thriller, starring Thomas Jane and Laurence Fishburne

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: The search continues for chateau shoppers Christina and Sassan, who hope that an unusual village centre property will fulfil their brief. In northern France, Emma has to learn new skills as she and Paul start work creating an al fresco bar and dining area. Meanwhile, Paul tries to engineer a set of vintage decks to be able to play his collection of 78s. Narrated by Adjoa Andoh

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Debbie and Nigel start to create a brand-new terrace for their hot tub. Taking on all the work themselves, its no simple task, especially when it comes to moving the delicate hot tub into position. Emma and Paul are on the home straight with their bar and dining area as they get ready for a dinner party, and Emma must get creative when it comes to the styling. Donna and Paul undertake a colossal renovation in their attic to build their own private apartment. The first task is to level up the floor that sags 25cms in the middle. Narrated by Adjoa Andoh

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc: Council worker Megan and builder Leyton are given a cute little terrace in Pontarddulais, in the south Wales valleys. The duo renovate a cute little terrace, complete with a tree growing through the upstairs window. They hope to make sense of the mess and clear the way for a tidy profit as Tayo Oguntonade, Simon OBrien and Carys Davies monitor their progress

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc: Plasterer Naomi and small business owner Terri-Anne are given a terrace in Royton, near Oldham. Untouched since the 1960s, its a real doer-upper with shedloads of potential. The pair get a lot of help from family and friends, but it remains to be seen whether the support will prove sufficient to deliver them a tidy profit

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman helps newlyweds Des and Julie find their dream permanent home in the town of Oliva in the Spanish region of Valencia. With a budget of £105,000, theyre hoping to buy their first property together, with at least three bedrooms for their big extended family. Will any of the properties that Ben shows them prove to be their perfect place?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.sub-title: Poole v La Rochelle, South West France
programme.desc: Friends Richard and Debby join forces to buy their dream home together for a combined budget of £700,000, but cannot agree where this property should be. Richards heart is in Poole, while Debby wants a change of pace in La Rochelle in western France. Jasmine Harman shows them three homes in Poole, while Laura Hamilton gives Jasmine a run for her money with three jaw-dropping French homes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition comes from in and around Brighton, where the first host, 30-year-old medical editor and rapper Adam, serves up a simple yet wholesome and flavoursome vegetarian menu. His guests are 29-year-old copywriter Will, 65-year-old retired advertising sales director Gill, 56-year-old builder Russell and 43-year-old teacher Jo

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Copywriter Will serves up a vegetarian meal on the second evening in Brighton. Theres a seafood surprise over the starter, which leaves teacher Jo with fishy fingers, and Wills risotto is upstaged by a Lady and the Tramp moment between retired sales director Gill and builder Russell. Not one to be outdone, Will gets everyone up to have it large in his living room with a rendition of his own dance track

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired advertising sales director Gill hosts the third dinner party of the week in and around Brighton, hoping to impress her guests with a Middle Eastern menu and a fun dress code. Jo, Adam, Will and a newcomer to the group, social worker Ruth, all arrive wearing hats to reflect their personalities, leading to some unexpected revelations and a chance to find out more about newcomer Ruth. Gills cooking impresses, but its not all plain sailing, as theres some honest feedback for her to swallow

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth host in and around Brighton, teacher and surfer Jo, treats her guests to an exotic, tropical-themed evening with a Thai menu. Her guests arrive in their most tropical attire, but after a confident start, with a cheeky massage thrown in for good measure, Jos hit-and-miss food and a dessert drama leave her slightly panicked

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Brighton, the final day of the competition sees social worker Ruth try to impress her guests with her Jewish-Irish fusion menu. Theres chaos in the kitchen before the guests even arrive, then after a mixed-up main and some unexpected veggies, Ruths secret family cheesecake has her guests guessing if it lives up to the bill

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This weeks competition kicks off at The Oaks Luxury Lodges in County Londonderry. A guided tour of iconic sights goes down well, but a full Irish breakfast proves divisive

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Bridie hosts the weeks second visit, at Pine Tree Hollow Glamping in Leitrim, Co Down, and is keen to show her guests that back to basics does not mean boring

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Isabel and her right-hand woman Aisling aim to wow the guests at their luxury Ness Wood Glamping site in Co Londonderry

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Dulrush Fishing Lodge on the banks of Lough Erne in Co Fermanagh, run by husband-and-wife team Bridie and James. The BandBers are in awe of the shoreline location, but one pair are disappointed to make some dusty discoveries. Naturally, Bridie and James take their guests out on the water for a spot of fishing, where a confession makes waves

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts meet for one last time to debate their differences and settle some scores. The Oaks Luxury Lodges want to clear up some breakfast bombshells, while Bridie from Pine Tree Hollow Glamping is keen to flush out the problem with her shared facilities. Isabel and Aisling want answers over some tit-for-tat comments, before James and Bridie from Dulrush Fishing Lodge pull back the covers on their bedtime blues

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Stuart and Rosie Treasurer from the Wirral plan to transform a small bungalow from a 1960s dormer into a slick piece of 21st-century architecture. The couple decapitate the building and balance a new floating timber box on top to create five bedrooms, spending as little as possible on plumbing, electrics and insulation, but stress levels spiral when neighbours grumble at the ultra-modern creation

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: At Queens Medical Centre in Nottingham, one of the busiest AandE departments in Europe, 77-year-old Keith is treated for a cardiac arrest and Joanna has a spinal fracture after falling from her horse. In the Urgent Treatment Unit, 79-year-old John is being patched up after being run over by a car at his local market

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: A man is rushed into Queens Medical Centre in Nottingham after his leg is crushed by a 12-tonne lorry. He may have developed a rare condition that can require amputation. Plus, nurse Christine describes how she realised her ambitions of working in the emergency department and put herself through college to get her nursing qualification, while raising two children as a single parent

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a woman who has a history of heart complaints and is experiencing crushing pain in her chest. She thinks she may be having a heart attack. A bingo caller who has diabetes feels so unwell that his colleagues ring 999. A mother-of-nine is finding life a struggle and has collapsed on the kitchen floor with a suspected seizure. A former sergeant major and veteran of the Falklands war may be having a stroke. Plus, the paramedics encounter a condition that they cannot treat - a flat tyre

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A head-on car accident in Cumbria leaves Nicks life hanging in the balance, East Anglian heli-meds land on a roundabout island to help Craig who has come off his motorbike and smashed headfirst into a signpost. Plus, medics battle extreme weather conditions to reach a man trapped under his JCB digger

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: At Queens Medical Centre in Nottingham, one of the busiest AandE departments in Europe, 77-year-old Keith is treated for a cardiac arrest and Joanna has a spinal fracture after falling from her horse. In the Urgent Treatment Unit, 79-year-old John is being patched up after being run over by a car at his local market

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: A man is rushed into Queens Medical Centre in Nottingham after his leg is crushed by a 12-tonne lorry. He may have developed a rare condition that can require amputation. Plus, nurse Christine describes how she realised her ambitions of working in the emergency department and put herself through college to get her nursing qualification, while raising two children as a single parent

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton uncovers something surprising about small hens eggs, Matt Tebbutt tracks down where the bubbles in beer come from, and Jimmy Doherty investigates why supermarket burgers should not be eaten when the meat is still pink

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Living in a chateau is a constant battle with maintenance, and for Erin and JB its no exception as they try to combat a leaky roof. Erin also has a creative art project to enhance their Yellow Salon for an anniversary dinner party. In Cognac Country, Sarah and George take on the challenge to makeover an entire estate cottage on a tiny budget, wanting to create a family bolthole for the busy wedding season

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Storms and bad weather have spelt disaster for Erin and JB, as part of the original mediaeval foundations of their island have collapsed into the moat. Trying to fix it all themselves, JBs engineering skills are put to the test when they try to raise the heavy stones. Stephanies tartan apartment project for Gerry continues as she rolls up her sleeves to sand blast the hayloft beams. Sarah and George agree to host the local town fete, but with a septic tank being installed just days before the event the grounds are far from picture perfect

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc: In Lancashire, Edrina and Scott take on a dated semi full of the previous owners possessions. With a small kitchen and bathroom, can they extend and still make a profit?

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc: Matt and Dominic renovate some dated digs in Derby. The 1960s archway into the kitchen is well and truly shown the door, but the rising cost of building supplies threatens to scupper their profit

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lee Juggurnauth jets off to the historic town of Mojácar in Spains Almería region to help house-hunters Christine and Howard find the perfect holiday home. After 30 years of marriage and a few difficult years back at home, the couple have decided its finally the right time to fulfil their long-held dream of buying a place in the sun. Lee sources five properties within their £50,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harmin and Laura Hamilton go head to head to help Sue and David Sherlock from Stockport. The couple want a fresh start with their daughter, but cannot decide where to start their new adventure. David is championing the Lake District, close to his three grown-up daughters, but Sue wants a complete change and thinks their future lies in the Dordogne region of France. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: David Harper buys an old fishing stool and Arusha Irvine splashes out on a parachuting clown as they travel through York and Durham. But only one can win at the Newcastle auction

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: David Harper finds out about British workhouses and Arusha Irvine learns the history of Victorian toilets as the pair continue their antiques search across Dundee and Yorkshire

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House

programme.title: Salvage Hunters

From Baris raw seafood and Cisterninos fornelli to cheesemaker Vitos Apulian blue cheeses, it is clear that by reclaiming their past, the Pugliese are taking ownership of their future and embracing it on their own terms
