programme.sub-title: Terri, Esme and the Chi Family
programme.desc: Pete meets Lurcher Terri, whos terrified of the world and must learn to trust again, and helps settle a family of chihuahuas given up by their heartbroken owner

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Miami Mega Jail
programme.desc: Part one of two. The contemplative reporter examines life in Miami County Jail, where most of the inmates are awaiting trial. He begins by exploring the large cage-like dwellings on the fifth and sixth floors, which are home to many of the most volatile prisoners. The inmates lives are governed by a gladiatorial code, leading to fights for food and status - a situation the guards say they are powerless to address

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Miami Mega Jail
programme.desc: Part two of two. The reporter goes deeper into the jail system, meeting an alleged triple murderer facing a possible death sentence. He also follows a group of younger convicts who have avoided prison by pleading guilty and attending a four-month military-style boot camp. Among them is a 14-year-old boy who may face a 10-year sentence for armed robbery if he cannot endure the harsh training and rehabilitation programme

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A woman longs to hold her baby, who was born with his bowels outside his body and has been in a critical condition ever since. Meanwhile, an expectant mother who underwent a Caesarean during the birth of her first child hopes her second delivery will go according to plan

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A mother coping with the death of her brother goes into labour with her fifth child, and her sister discusses how the pregnancy has helped the family cope with the bereavement. Meanwhile, a woman who received IVF treatment anxiously prepares to give birth, but when her waters fail to break she is asked to consider undergoing a Caesarean

programme.title: My Family
programme.sub-title: And Ill Cry if I Want To
programme.desc: Another Christmas with the Harper family sees Scrooge-like patriarch Ben at his most miserable, as wife Susan is busy giving grandson Kenzo a third birthday to remember, his hated mother-in-law Grace gets herself a toyboy and eldest son Nick sends a present that could have a lasting effect on the entire household. Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker star, with Daniela Denby-Ashe, Gabriel Thomson, Siobhan Hayes and Rosemary Leach

programme.title: Louis Therouxs LA Stories
programme.desc: California has some of the toughest regulations controlling sex offenders anywhere in America - after leaving prison they can spend years on parole being tagged and tracked and a lifetime on an online register. In his final film exploring different aspects of life in Los Angeles, Louis Theroux visits hostels to talk to parolees as well as the people charged with monitoring them, and asks whether the restrictions keep society safer and when, if ever, it is right to give sex offenders a second chance

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sooze found the birth of her first baby easy and confidently arrives at Southmead with her husband Joe, but the contractions quickly get the better of her. Teri and Merv, who are about to have their fourth child, talk about the cravings Teri has experienced this time round, while Becki and Ian nervously await their new arrival, having finally committed to each other following an on-off romance

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Ever since suffering a brain infection four years ago, Sunderland woman June Findlay has been unable to walk or talk and is totally dependent on her devoted husband John. Since then she has been sleeping on a hospital bed in the kitchen, with no washing or toilet facilities. Joan and John do their best, but Nick Knowles believes they deserve better, so he and his small band of builders - bolstered by an army of local tradespeople - set out to extend the Findlays home, with designer Oliver Heath on hand to protect his vision. Can they give June back her dignity?

The builders have just nine days to bring the property up to date and give this tired mum and dad the space they need for their active offspring. programme.desc: With a place in the Grand Finale on the line, the Top 4 duos must not only make one of Gordons dishes at the same speed as he makes it, but also do it while taking turns cooking

programme.desc: The Stoke crews cope with a major heart attack and a nasty football injury, while in Dudley, the paramedics help an elderly diabetic man with severe stomach pains

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The response teams rush to save the life of a 21-year-old man who has been shot twice in the chest at a pub in Doncaster. Another man has a seizure high up in the cab of his tipper truck

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A doctor on his way home from work is left fighting for his life after a head-on collision with a truck. Leeds paramedic Chris is called to a motorcyclist who has been hit by a taxi

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A teenager prepares for the birth of her first child, and her paramedic mother struggles with the prospect of her daughter becoming a parent. Plus, a free-spirited woman who is eight days overdue arrives at the hospital, but doctors become concerned by the babys heartbeat

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A man struggles with the knowledge that his partner is pregnant with someone elses child, but thoughts of paternity are pushed to the back of his mind when complications arise during labour. Meanwhile, an anxious husband finds it difficult to see his wife in so much pain during the birth of their first baby

programme.title: Tom Daley: Illegal to Be Me
programme.desc: The Olympic diving champion investigates homophobic behaviour around the Commonwealth, travelling to some of the countries where homosexuality is a crime and even punishable by death. Daley talks to sportspeople facing persecution and advocates fighting for change, including Michael Gunning of Jamaica, Indias Dutee Chand and swimmers Theresa Goh (of Singapore) and Amini Fonua (of Tonga)

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: West Midlands paramedics assess a man police have found acting erratically on a busy dual carriageway and believe has taken the powerful psychoactive Monkey Dust

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos railway journey reaches Greater Manchester, where he celebrates new beginnings for the nation in the years after the Second World War. At Trafford General Hospital, he investigates the birth of the National Health Service. A retired physiotherapist recalls her part in the historic event of July 5, 1948. Coronation Star tells Michael about the first episode of the soap, broadcast live in 1960. And at the citys Science and Industry Museum, the presenter encounters a replica of the Baby, which was created in 1948 - the first machine in the world to run a stored program and the forerunner of all modern computers

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by tram to the former cotton town of Oldham on the edge of the Peak District. Here he visits Oldham Coliseum, the towns Victorian repertory theatre, and hears about the lifting of censorship by the Lord Chamberlains Office in the late 1960s. He then goes hiking before a visit to Sheffield, where he attends a knife-making workshop. He ends this part of his journey admiring the striking post-war sculptures of Barbara Hepworth at the Yorkshire Sculpture Park near Wakefield

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Wakefield, West Yorkshire, Michael Portillo visits the National Coal Mining Museum for England at Caphouse Colliery. In Leeds, he heads for the Chapeltown area to investigate the origins of the Leeds West Indian carnival in 1967 and tries his hand on the steel drums

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his post-war exploration of northwest England in Bradford, Shipley and Hebden Bridge. In Bradfords Centenary Square, he encounters local literary giant, JB Priestley. At Shipley station, Michael discovers a nature reserve in the middle of the car park. Finally the Calder Valley Line delivers the presenter to the photogenic station at Hebden Bridge

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek navigates the dry stone walls of the Peak District to collect a very original 1988 Opel Manta. Plus, Dave deals with a Ford Granada rally support vehicle

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek has a three-hour drive in a 1960s bus that arrived in the UK after a life in the sun. Dave takes a Triumph TR7 convertible to auction

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: While America had Ford, Chrysler and Buick, Hitler also wanted a car that would transform his nation - the peoples car, or Volkswagen

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates an account of the liberation of Paris and Brussels in 1944, events which to many signified the end of the war. However, as the German forces retreated, Poland fell victim to one of the most tragic events of the war, Documentary chronicling the Second World War

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts return to Chatsworth House in Derbyshire to inspect more objects and rarities brought in by members of the public. Among the items up for inspection are a painting believed to be by Constable, and a set of designs for exotic Cartier jewellery from the mid-20th century

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts visit Blair Castle in Perthshire, where items up for valuation include a chair once used by Albert Einstein, a rare watch with no hands, and a necklace made from stags teeth

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek goes to pick up a veteran 1904 Swift, theres an emotional farewell to a 1980s Bedford HA van, and a Toyota Corona finds a new home

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek Mathewson gives the once-over to a Royale Formula Ford race car, and Paul Mathewson is on a marathon trip to Teesside to pick up a 1953 MGYB

However, as the German forces retreated, Poland fell victim to one of the most tragic events of the war, Documentary chronicling the Second World War

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce introduces more items from the shows visits to Hutton-in-the-Forest in Cumbria, Chatsworth in Derbyshire and the British Museum in London. Highlights include a painting that was once given away in a competition, the largest Faberge egg to be seen on the programme and police records that expose a plot to assassinate a former prime minister

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming journeys through Royal Leamington Spa and the historic town of Warwick with its medieval castle.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul and Jack head to Staffordshire to pick up five vehicles from collector Robs colossal barn, including a Mini and a Morris Minor

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will go for the once-maligned Austin Maestro. The car they want to buy has already been sold but the seller has another - his own - on the driveway. Can they do a deal?

programme.desc: Derek goes to pick up a veteran 1904 Swift, theres an emotional farewell to a 1980s Bedford HA van, and a Toyota Corona finds a new home

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The worlds most impressive disused railway bridges, including the biggest wooden trestle bridge in the world, which was closed down due to hurricane damage

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming journeys through Royal Leamington Spa and the historic town of Warwick with its medieval castle.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Londons Docklands to the Barbican, examining the story of the arrival at Tilbury in 1948 of the Empire Windrush, which brought more than a thousand passengers from the Caribbean to work in Britain. In Limehouse, Michael reflects on the Labour Partys landslide victory at the post-war general election of 1945 and hears what drove new prime minister Clement Attlee to strive for social change

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits several of Londons most famous locations, beginning on the South Bank, where the 1951 Festival of Britain drew more than eight and a half million visitors to admire fantastical buildings designed to inspire and celebrate the best of British in art, science and industry. After a spin on the London Eye, built to celebrate the millennium, Michael takes the London Underground to Chelsea to find out about Elizabeth David, one of the most influential cookery writers of the 20th century, and also heads to Covent Garden and Regents Park

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures deep underground onto Londons newest railway - the Elizabeth Line - enjoying a smooth ride from Paddington to Tottenham Court Road. Emerging into the sunshine in Bedford Square, Michael recalls the choking smogs which plagued the capital during the 1950s. He learns how smoke-free zones were introduced to tackle the problem and, high above the capital at the top of the BT Tower, discovers how the capitals air quality is monitored today

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs

programme.desc: The large number of rivers that criss-cross the UK, providing a rich habitat for wildlife. programme.title: Britains Spending Secrets
programme.desc: Anne Robinson embarks on a two-part investigation into how British people spend their money, meeting consumers from across the wealth spectrum to put their spending habits under the spotlight. The presenters sample group ranges from billionaires to benefits claimants, all of whom she accompanies on spending sprees to discover whether there is any relationship between where and how people choose to part with their hard-won cash, and their personal values. Anne begins by introducing a single mother on benefits who has fallen into debt by spending beyond her means, a super-rich entrepreneur who only believes in handing over cash for things that will increase his wealth, a baroness with a passion for thriftiness and an eco-warrior who tries not to spend anything at all

programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the high-end removals industry in the UK, meeting the wealthy clients moving priceless objects, and the firms tasked with completing the precarious jobs. programme.title: Britains Spending Secrets
programme.desc: Anne Robinson concludes her two-part investigation into Britains spending habits, asking whether it is possible for a person to spend their way to happiness. She meets billionaire John Caudwell, one of the UKs richest men with a home worth £90million, who explains why his extraordinary personal wealth has not been able to negate the sadness in his life. Anne discovers how an inability to spend can also cause intense distress when she encounters Brian, who has fallen on hard times, and depends on a local food bank to survive. Also featured are Katie, a working mother who campaigned to have a branch of Waitrose opened near her home, and Rosie, the wife of an affluent City banker, who claims to be an ethical shopper for whom every purchase must conform to strict moral guidelines

programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as Abbey Clancy, Pasha Kovalev and Katherine Ryan cook their best date night dishes for their partners Peter Crouch, Rachel Riley and Bobby Kootstra in the first three-way cooking battle of the series. The winner will secure a place in the semi-final while the bottom two will fight for their place in the competition in the cook-off

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Four people who have never met before - Josh from St Neots, Ann originally from Reading, Fergus from Glasgow and Sarah from Ipswich - take on the Chaser. In a battle of wits. Bradley Walsh guides the contestants through the show, in the hope theyll go home with thousands of pounds

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Tracey from Berkshire, Steve from Cumbria, Elle from Sale and Matt from Bradford pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Can Ian from Middlesex, Jennie originally from Cornwall, Gregor from Edinburgh and Karen from Macclesfield come together as a team to take down one of the countrys finest quiz brains? Watch as Bradley Walsh hosts and they try to take a Chaser down for thousands of pounds

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: Ian Wright hosts as three more teams of two try to bank money by dropping a ball from the Launcher onto an amount of cash. Husband and wife Ben and Helen are aiming for a round-the-world trip, lifelong friends Brian and Andy want to take a nostalgic golfing holiday in style, and mother-and-daughter Shan and Babs hope to take their family to Jamaica to see their relatives

programme.title: The British Airways Killer
programme.desc: Part two of two. A three-day long police interview of Robert Brown finally ended with a confession and the pilot leading officers to the site where Joanna Simpson was buried, a remote spot in Windsor Great Park. The trial that followed saw Brown deny murder with a defence of adjustment disorder due to diminished responsibility and 13 years on, he has served half his prison sentence and is due to be released. Can a high-profile campaign from Joannas family keep him behind bars?

programme.title: Below Deck: Mediterranean
programme.desc: The crew enjoys a day off at an exclusive beach club in Mallorca, and romance is in the air when Malias boyfriend Tom arrives for a visit.
